name: Mercure Stoller Zurich

reviews.title: Nice place, but misses air conditionning & can be noisy
reviews.text: I actually like this hotel even if it has some drawbacks (this is my third stay there). Its location is convenient for my business, rooms are decent, they have Free wired Internet access and a better than average choice with Free Digital TV channels.

reviews.title: OK but will try someplace else next time
reviews.text: My complaints would be regarding: lack of air-conditioning in rooms which would be acceptable if the street level wasn't so noisy. So if it's hot and you're sensible to noise get a room not on the street size.

reviews.title: A reasonably pleasant trip was had
reviews.text: Note: lift is accessible after a few steps from the reception.

reviews.title: Good value in a pricey city; no air con
reviews.text: This hotel can only be described as average, so whther you enjoy your say depends on whether you pay an average price or not. There is ample stret construction in the area, which is already congested, so it took about 30 minutes to travel the last couple of kilometers. Ther is little parking - we were fortunate to receive a spot. Breakfast is outrageously expenses, as are the restaurants n the area, but that is typical of Switzerland. The TV is an old CRT in a room that is very small and the room temperature was uncomfortably warm. The shower is very small with a curtain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this hotel. Sebastian was very helpful on our arrival. we were delighted with the room - spacious, on 5th floor, at back of the building, so very quite and comfortable. Hotel has been refurbished and everything is new. We are looking forward to our next visit. Tram stop is nearby, with direct line to Paradeplatz (line 2), every 7 mins. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.
reviews.title: An excellent value hotel in Zurich

reviews.text: This is probably one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in my life and probably the worst so-called 4* hotel in Europe. It's a shame that is being marketed as being a memmber of Accorhotels.

description: The Mercure Stoller Zurich is a traditionally run 4 star hotel, offering 80 non smoking rooms, a restaurant with an outdoor terrace, two meeting rooms and a bar where guests can enjoy a nightcap. The hotel is conveniently located in the west of the cityand is very easy to get to by public transport. There is a direct connection to the main railway station (3.2 km away) and the airport is 10 km away with a convenient shuttle connection.
